Posted By: OutlawD1 (8/30/2009 1:32:32 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Used to be my favorite. Back in Alpha, this dragon was sheer terror to behold - it would usually end the game the turn after being cast.   
  
However, in today's meta, Shivan Dragon isn't one of the only good fatties out there anymore, and not quite as playable. Still, it deserves a special place in many of our hearts.

posts.post_content: I'm glad they went back to this art. IMO this is the best art for this card and arguably one of the best looking dragons in Magic. I liked the *idea* of the Jund dragons, but I didn't like how they looked.

Posted By: swordoath (10/9/2009 12:09:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: One of the few big creatures from very early in the game's history that WotC didn't saddle with some ridiculous drawback, and therefore one of the few such creatures that are playable. While it is extremely rare that there would be any reason to run this in Constructed, this remains, as always, an enormous Limited bomb and a huge favourite at casual tables everywhere.
posts.html:
One of the few big creatures from very early in the game's history that WotC didn't saddle with some ridiculous drawback, and therefore one of the few such creatures that are playable. While it is extremely rare that there would be any reason to run this in Constructed, this remains, as always, an enormous Limited bomb and a huge favourite at casual tables everywhere.

Posted By: jeff-heikkinen (10/2/2009 12:10:51 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
As my friend pointed out, this card is a little slow for a red card. A good burn deck should kill within 5 turns.  
  
Though this creature is rather good. I've won many a match having 2 of this out, and just pumping the one my opponent did not block.
